page.title: 12Bredon Hancocks School
page.content: In 1718 Hancocks school was founded as a{Bluecoat school}for boys to be educated to become apprentices.In 1870 a law came in that everyone had to go to school.So the school became a Church of England School for boys.In 1932 the School became a{Senior {Elementary}for boys and girls over 11.They came from Eckington,Kemerton, Conderton,Beckford,Ashton Under Hill and of course Bredon.In 1944 the name changed to a{Secondary Modern}School but nothing else changed.In 1964 the Secondary Modern moved to a bigger bilding at Ashton and all the teachers and equipment moved too .Now Bredon Hancocks was empty so the primary school which was based farther up the village moved in so the school which was once a Bluecoat school was now a {primary school}for 5_11 years old.
